bibl.title: Letter from A.S. von Mansfelde to Mabel H. Lazear, May 24, 1908

div1.p: Von Mansfelde writes that the president supports the annuity bill.

div1.head: Letter from A.S. von Mansfelde to Mabel H. Lazear, May 24, 1908
div1.opener:
Nebraska State Medical Association
A. S. v. Mansfelde, M. D. Treasurer
“Quality Hill,” Ashland, Nebraska
No. 2924
May 24th 1908
Mrs. Mabel H. Lazear
Santa Barbara
Cal.
Dear Mrs. Lazear,
div1.p:
It occurred to me that you would
like to have a copy of the bill now in
the hands of the President to be signed
by him for your and Mrs. Carroll's benefit
so I send you one herewith.

Mr Mead writes me under date May 22nd,
received today, that he has telegraphed you
about the Senate passing the bill unanimous
ly. We surmises:

“As the President has recommended the
legislation to Congress, in transmitting the memo-
randum, prepared by Surgeon General O'Reilly,
there is no question as to his approving the bill

The Senate Pensions Committee, to which the
Dalzell bill was referred reported it favorably,
no doubt, at the earnest solicitation of Senators
Knox and Dick. The measure being before the
Senate unanimous consent was obtained for
its consideration and approval.”
C1
B17
I will be on “needles and pins” until I
get that telegram from Hinshaw and
I sincerely hope he will be prompt about
it.

I forget to say to you should you
wish to write me again after the
receipt of this letter, remember I expect
to be with Mr Thomas C. Lazear, at
least a week, provided I am not
called home-; he writes me that he will
not listen to less than 2 weeks-

My letter of yesterday sounds now
“ preachy ” to me. I trust you will take
no offense at it, for I mean only well
by you and your babies
